Comments: Both commands create an OSPFv3 instance with the ID 1.
The Nokia command implicitly sets the router ID within the OSPFv3 context, while Huawei uses a separate router-id command. Both achieve the same result.
Both commands create an OSPFv3 area with the ID 0.0.0.1.

Huawei:
interface GigabitEthernet2/0/0
undo shutdown
ipv6 enable
ipv6 address 2001:db8:2::2/64
Comments: Both configurations enable the interface, enable IPv6, and assign the IPv6 address 2001:db8:2::2/64.

Huawei:
interface GigabitEthernet3/0/0
undo shutdown
ipv6 enable
ipv6 address 2001:db8:4::1/64
Comments: Both configurations enable the interface, enable IPv6, and assign the IPv6 address 2001:db8:4::1/64.
